sentences: Adolf Rzepko (1825 – 1892) was a Polish composer, oboist, choral and orchestral conductor, and pianist.
He was a disciple of Václav Tomášek.
He was mainly active as a performer (he served for many years as the Wielki Theatre orchestra's principal oboe), a choral conductor and a pedagogue.
He was the author of two music treatises: The principles of music (1869) and A piano school.
Grove Dictionary of Music and Musicians, 1980 - vol.
Adolf Rzepko's music sheets in digital library Polona.pl
